I am trying to vary the file stflame1.py to calculate the heat flux  
to th=
e wall at a fixed surface temperature. At the momoment I am 
calculating th=
e heat flux from the T-gradient and the thermal 
conductivity near the non-=
reacting wall, however,this is not too 
accurate, since the last point befo=
re the wall is not near enough to 
the wall. I also tried to evaluate the e=
nthalpy change of the gas 
near the wall, but again I have the same problem=
. If 'slope' is 
reduced, 
the calculation is quite time consuming...

Is i=
t possible to fix only one single point of the grid (perhaps 1 
micron from=
 the wall or so), to overcome this problem? Or is there 
even an easier way=
 to get the heat flux?

Can anybody help me?
Thank you!

Regards,
